searchDocs.title: Welcome to the QA ZERO Blog
searchDocs.content: Hello and welcome! This blog is the beginning of an exciting journey where we aim to share insights, updates, and knowledge about QA ZERO and its development. Here, you can expect to find a variety of content, including: Product Philosophy: Learn about the principles and ideas that drive QA ZERO.Roadmap and Release Plans: Stay updated on upcoming features and improvements.Development Practices: Discover the tools, techniques, and methodologies we use.Tips and Tricks: Get practical advice for making the most out of QA ZERO. We hope this blog becomes a valuable resource for our community. Thank you for joining us on this journey! Stay tuned for more updates!

searchDocs.title: QA ZERO API
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The QA ZERO REST API enables programmatic access to QA ZERO analytics data. Query your page view data, search console metrics, and behavioral analytics using a simple, structured query language (QAL).  Base URL:  /wp-json/qa-platform/   Available Endpoints:  /qa-platform/guide - Retrieve API documentation and server information/qa-platform/query - Execute QAL queries

searchDocs.title: Why QA ZERO API?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Simple & Structured: QAL provides a clear, unambiguous way to query analytics dataWordPress Native: Uses WordPress REST API and Application PasswordsColumn-Oriented: Fast queries on large datasetsAI-Friendly: Designed for easy integration with AI tools and MCP servers

searchDocs.title: Versioning Strategy‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO uses calendar-based versioning instead of traditional v1, v2 numbering.

searchDocs.title: Why Calendar Versioning?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Following GitHub's approach, we use dates (YYYY-MM-DD) to represent natural API evolution:  Clear Timeline: Easy to understand when features were introducedNon-Linear Evolution: Breaking changes don't force a complete version bumpLong-Term Support: Each version maintained for minimum 24 monthsNatural Naming: No confusion about v1 vs v2 vs v3

searchDocs.title: How to Specify Version‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add the version query parameter to any endpoint:  GET /qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20

searchDocs.title: Default Behavior (QA ZERO)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If the version parameter is omitted, QA ZERO uses the oldest stable version for maximum reliability and backward compatibility. This ensures existing integrations continue to work even when new versions are released.  Example:  GET /qa-platform/query # Uses the oldest stable version (currently 2025-10-20)   Why oldest version? QA ZERO acts as a reliable data warehouse for system integrations, prioritizing stability over new features.

searchDocs.title: 2025-10-20 (Current)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Status: ‚úÖ Released Plugin Version Required: 3.0.0.0+ Support Until: 2027-10-20 (minimum)  Features:  Basic QAL queries with from and keepTwo materials: allpv (page views) and gsc (Google Search Console)Simple result options: limit and count_only  Documentation: Version 2025-10-20 ‚Üí  Best For:  Getting started with QA ZERO APISimple page view queriesSEO keyword analysisLearning QAL basics QR

searchDocs.title: 1. Set Up Authentication‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Create an Application Password in WordPress:  Go to Users ‚Üí Your ProfileScroll to Application PasswordsEnter name: "QA API Access"Click Add New Application PasswordCopy the generated password

searchDocs.title: 2. Test the Connection‚Äã
searchDocs.content: curl -u "username:your_app_password" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20"

searchDocs.title: 3. Run Your First Query‚Äã
searchDocs.content: curl -X POST \ -u "username:your_app_password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "my_view": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, "result": { "use": "my_view", "limit": 10 } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"

searchDocs.title: Version Comparison‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Feature	2025-10-20Materials	allpv, gsc QAL - make	from, keep only QAL - filter	‚ùå Not supported QAL - join	‚ùå Not supported QAL - calc	‚ùå Not supported Result options	limit, count_only Return formats	JSON only

searchDocs.title: When New Versions are Released‚Äã
searchDocs.content: When a new version is released, your existing queries continue to work:  Existing queries: Keep using ?version=2025-10-20New features: Test with new version parameterGradual migration: Update queries one at a timeNo forced upgrades: Old versions supported for 24+ months

searchDocs.title: Breaking Changes Policy‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Breaking changes only happen with new version dates:  Breaking change: New version required (e.g., 2026-03-01)New feature: Same version, backward compatibleBug fix: Same version, no change neededDocumentation: Version number unchanged

searchDocs.content: Documentation: Version 2025-10-20Support: https://support.claude.comRepository: https://github.com/quarka-org/docs.qazero.com

searchDocs.title: 2025-10-20 - Initial Release‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Released:  Basic QAL with from and keep operationsTwo materials: allpv and gscSimple result options: limit and count_only

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This is the initial release of QA ZERO API, providing simple and straightforward access to page view and search console data.  Version: 2025-10-20 Status: Current Release

searchDocs.title: What's Included in This Version‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚úÖ Materials:  allpv - Page view data from view_pvgsc - Google Search Console data  ‚úÖ QAL Features:  from - Specify data sourcekeep - Select columns to return  ‚úÖ Result Options:  limit - Limit number of rowscount_only - Return count instead of data  ‚ùå Not Yet Available:  filter - Row filteringjoin - Combining materialscalc - AggregationsCSV/Parquet output formats

searchDocs.title: Authentication‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO API uses WordPress Application Passwords for authentication.

searchDocs.title: Creating an Application Password‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Log in to WordPress adminGo to Users ‚Üí Your ProfileScroll to Application Passwords sectionEnter application name: "QA API Access"Click Add New Application PasswordCopy the password - you won't see it again!

searchDocs.title: Using the Password‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Include credentials in every API request using Basic Authentication:  Format:  Authorization: Basic base64(username:application_password)   Example (curl):  curl -u "admin:xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20"   Example (JavaScript):  const username = 'admin'; const password = 'xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx'; const auth = btoa(`${username}:${password}`); fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20', { headers: { 'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}` } }) .then(res => res.json()) .then(data => console.log(data));

searchDocs.title: Base URL‚Äã
searchDocs.content: All endpoints are under the WordPress REST API namespace:  https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/

searchDocs.title: Available Endpoints‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Endpoint	Method	Purpose/qa-platform/guide	GET	Get API documentation /qa-platform/materials	GET	List available materials /qa-platform/query	POST	Execute QAL query

searchDocs.title: Version Parameter‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Always specify the API version in your requests:  ?version=2025-10-20   Example:  GET /qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20 POST /qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20   If omitted: Latest stable version is used (currently 2025-10-20)

searchDocs.title: Step 1: Check Available Materials‚Äã
searchDocs.content: curl -u "username:password" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20"   Response:  { "meta": { "version": "2025-10-20" }, "data": { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv", "description": "Page view data", "columns": [...] }, { "name": "gsc", "description": "Google Search Console data", "columns": [...] } ] } }

searchDocs.title: Step 2: Run a Simple Query‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get the latest 10 page views:  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "recent_pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time"] } }, "result": { "use": "recent_pvs", "limit": 10 } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   Response:  { "data": [ { "url": "https://example.com/page1", "title": "Page 1", "access_time": "2025-10-15T14:30:00" }, ... ], "meta": { "truncated": false, "row_count": 10, "limits": { "row_limit": 5000 } } }

searchDocs.title: Step 3: Count Total Rows‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use count_only to get just the count:  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "all_pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.pv_id"] } }, "result": { "use": "all_pvs", "count_only": true } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   Response:  { "count": 15234 }

searchDocs.title: Minimal Query Structure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss", "end": "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "view_name": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.column1", "allpv.column2"] } }, "result": { "use": "view_name", "limit": 100 } }

searchDocs.title: What Each Part Does‚Äã
searchDocs.content: tracking_id: Specify which site to query  Must match a tracking_id from /guide endpointEach site has its own data and materials  materials: Declare which data sources you'll use  Must match available materials: allpv or gsc  time: Set the time range  start: Beginning of range (inclusive)end: End of range (exclusive)tz: Timezone (IANA format)  make: Define your view  from: Source material (array with one element)keep: Columns to include (fully qualified: material.column)  result: Specify output  use: Which view to returnlimit: Maximum rows (default: 100, max: 5000)count_only: Return count instead of data (optional)

searchDocs.title: Pattern 1: Get Specific Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "basic_info": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.access_time" ] } }, "result": { "use": "basic_info", "limit": 100 } }

searchDocs.title: Pattern 2: GSC Keywords‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "materials": [{"name": "gsc"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "keywords": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr" ] } }, "result": { "use": "keywords", "limit": 50 } }

searchDocs.title: Pattern 3: Count Rows‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "total": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.pv_id"] } }, "result": { "use": "total", "count_only": true } }

searchDocs.title: Error Handling‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Standard HTTP status codes:  Status	Meaning200	Success 400	Bad Request (invalid QAL) 401	Unauthorized (invalid credentials) 404	Not Found (invalid tracking_id or endpoint) 500	Internal Server Error  Error Response Format:  { "code": "E_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID", "message": "Unknown tracking_id: 'invalid123'", "data": { "tracking_id": "invalid123", "available_sites": [ {"tracking_id": "abc123", "domain": "example.com"}, {"tracking_id": "def456", "domain": "blog.example.com"} ] } }   Common Error Codes:  E_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID - Invalid or missing tracking_idE_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL - Material not available for this siteE_UNKNOWN_COLUMN - Invalid column nameE_TIME_REQUIRED - Missing time specificationE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED - Unsupported QAL feature

searchDocs.title: JavaScript (Fetch API)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: const auth = btoa('username:password'); const baseUrl = 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform'; async function getPageViews() { const query = { version: "1.5.2", materials: [{name: "allpv"}], time: { start: "2025-10-01T00:00:00", end: "2025-10-20T00:00:00", tz: "Asia/Tokyo" }, make: { pvs: { from: ["allpv"], keep: ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, result: { use: "pvs", limit: 10 } }; const response = await fetch(`${baseUrl}/query?version=2025-10-20`, { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}`, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(query) }); const data = await response.json(); return data; } getPageViews().then(console.log);

searchDocs.title: Python (Requests)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: import requests from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth base_url = 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform' query = { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, "result": { "use": "pvs", "limit": 10 } } response = requests.post( f'{base_url}/query?version=2025-10-20', json=query, auth=HTTPBasicAuth('username', 'password') ) data = response.json() print(data)

searchDocs.title: Next Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Endpoints Reference - Detailed endpoint documentationQAL Guide - Complete QAL syntax for this versionMaterials Reference - Available materials and columns

searchDocs.title: Future Versions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Future releases will add:  Filtering (filter)Joins (join)Aggregations (calc)Additional materialsCSV/Parquet export  Stay tuned for updates!

searchDocs.title: Materials Reference (2025-10-20)
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This version provides two materials:  Material	Type	Source	Description	Plugin Verallpv	Log	view_pv function	Page view data with visitor info	3.0.0.0+ gsc	Log	get_gsc_lp_query function	Google Search Console data	3.0.0.0+  Source: Both materials are retrieved from file_functions.php

searchDocs.title: allpv Material‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Page view data including visitor information, device details, and behavioral metrics.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The allpv material provides comprehensive page view data extracted from the view_pv function. It includes identity information, page details, referral sources, UTM parameters, device/browser information, and timing metrics.  Source Function: file_functions.php::view_pv

searchDocs.title: Field Changes in Plugin 3.0.0.0‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Removed Fields (not available in this version):  ‚ùå session_id - Session identifier‚ùå tracking_domain - Tracking domain‚ùå path_prefix - URL path prefix‚ùå utm_content - UTM content parameter‚ùå utm_term - UTM term parameter‚ùå version_id - Version history ID‚ùå All goal fields: is_goal_0 through is_goal_10, is_submit  Changed Fields:  üîÑ country ‚Üí country_code (now ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format)

searchDocs.title: Available Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Identity & Session‚Äã  Column	Type	Description	Indexedpv_id	uint64	Unique page view identifier	‚úì  | reader_id | uint64 | Visitor identifier (persistent) | ‚úì |  Page Information‚Äã  Column	Type	Description	Indexedpage_id	uint64	Page identifier	‚úì url	string	Full page URL	Partial* title	string	Page title	-  *Partial index: Exact match or parameter-free exact match only  Referral & UTM Parameters‚Äã  Column	Type	Description	Indexedsource_domain	string	Referrer domain	- referrer	string	Full referrer URL	- utm_source	string	UTM source parameter	- utm_medium	string	UTM medium parameter	- utm_campaign	string	UTM campaign parameter	-  Device & Browser‚Äã  Column	Type	Description	Indexedua	string	User Agent (partial)	- device_type	string	Device type: "dsk", "smp", "tab"	- os	string	Operating system (Windows, iOS, Android, etc.)	‚úì browser	string	Browser (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, etc.)	‚úì language	string	User language	‚úì country_code	string	User country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)	‚úì  Timing & Behavior‚Äã  Column	Type	Description	Indexedaccess_time	int64	Page view timestamp (ISO8601)	‚úì pv	uint16	Page number within session	- speed_msec	uint16	Page load time (milliseconds, 0-65535)	- browse_sec	uint16	Browse time (seconds, 0-65535)	- is_last	bool	Exit flag (last page in session)	- is_newuser	bool	New user flag	-

searchDocs.title: Common Column Sets‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Basic page info:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time" ] }   Traffic source analysis:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.source_domain", "allpv.utm_source", "allpv.utm_medium", "allpv.utm_campaign" ] }   Device analysis:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser" ] }   User behavior:  { "keep": [ "allpv.reader_id", "allpv.pv", "allpv.browse_sec", "allpv.is_newuser", "allpv.is_last" ] }

searchDocs.title: Example Queries‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get recent page views:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "recent": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time" ] } }, "result": { "use": "recent", "limit": 10 } }   Mobile traffic:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "mobile": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser" ] } }, "result": { "use": "mobile", "limit": 100 } }   New vs returning visitors:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "visitors": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.reader_id", "allpv.is_newuser", "allpv.access_time" ] } }, "result": { "use": "visitors", "limit": 500 } }

searchDocs.title: gsc Material‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Google Search Console data for SEO analysis.

searchDocs.title: Description‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The gsc material provides search performance data from Google Search Console, including keywords, impressions, clicks, and ranking positions. Data is aggregated by page and keyword combination.  Source Function: file_functions.php::get_gsc_lp_query

searchDocs.title: Available Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Column	Type	Descriptionpage_id	int	Page identifier title	string	Page title url	string	Page URL search_type	int	Search type (web, image, video) keyword	string	Search keyword/query clicks_sum	int	Total clicks for period impressions_sum	int	Total impressions for period ctr	float	Click-through rate (clicks/impressions) position_wavg	float	Weighted average position first_position	float	First position in period latest_position	float	Latest position in period position_history	string	Daily position history (CSV format)

searchDocs.title: Column Details‚Äã
searchDocs.content: page_id:  Links to the same page_id in allpv materialCan be used for joining (in future versions)  search_type:  Numeric code for search typeCommon values: web search, image search, video search  keyword:  The actual search query users enteredExact match from Google Search Console  clicks_sum:  Total number of clicks from this keyword to this pageAggregated over the time period  impressions_sum:  Total number of times the page appeared in search resultsFor this specific keyword  ctr:  Click-through rate: clicks_sum / impressions_sumCalculated automaticallyRange: 0.0 to 1.0 (0% to 100%)  position_wavg:  Weighted average ranking positionLower is better (1.0 = top position)Weighted by impressions  first_position:  Ranking position at the start of the periodUseful for tracking movement  latest_position:  Ranking position at the end of the periodCompare with first_position to see trends  position_history:  Daily position data in CSV formatExample: "2025-10-01:5.2,2025-10-02:4.8,2025-10-03:4.5"

searchDocs.title: Common Column Sets‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Basic keyword performance:  { "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr" ] }   Ranking analysis:  { "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.url", "gsc.position_wavg", "gsc.first_position", "gsc.latest_position" ] }   Complete keyword data:  { "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.url", "gsc.title", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr", "gsc.position_wavg" ] }

searchDocs.title: Example Queries‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Top keywords by clicks:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "gsc"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "top_keywords": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr" ] } }, "result": { "use": "top_keywords", "limit": 50 } }   Ranking positions:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "gsc"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "rankings": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.url", "gsc.position_wavg", "gsc.first_position", "gsc.latest_position" ] } }, "result": { "use": "rankings", "limit": 100 } }   Page-level SEO performance:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "gsc"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "page_seo": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.url", "gsc.title", "gsc.keyword", "gsc.clicks_sum" ] } }, "result": { "use": "page_seo", "limit": 200 } }

searchDocs.title: Data Types Reference‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Type	Range	Description	Exampleuint8	0-255	Small integer	goal flags uint16	0-65,535	Medium integer	browse_sec, speed_msec uint32	0-4,294,967,295	Large integer	version_id uint64	0-18+ quintillion	Very large integer	pv_id, reader_id int	-2B to +2B	Signed integer	page_id, search_type int64	Very large range	Large signed integer	access_time (timestamp) float	Decimal	Floating point number	ctr, position_wavg string	Variable	Text data	url, title, keyword bool	true/false	Boolean flag	is_newuser, is_last

searchDocs.title: Using Indexed Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Columns marked "Indexed: ‚úì" support faster queries in future versions when filtering becomes available.  Currently indexed columns:  allpv:  pv_id - Unique identifierreader_id - Visitor trackingpage_id - Page referencetracking_domain - Site filteringurl - Page URL (partial)os - Operating systembrowser - Browser typelanguage - User languagecountry - Geographic dataaccess_time - Time-based queries  Note: While indexing exists in the database, this version doesn't support filtering yet. Indexes will be utilized when the filter feature is added in future versions.

searchDocs.title: Future Enhancements‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Planned for future versions:  Additional Materials:  clicks - Click event dataec - E-commerce transactionsinner_search - Internal site searchpage_detail - Extended page information  Enhanced Columns:  Behavioral metrics (scroll depth, dwell time)Page type classificationEnhanced UTM trackingCustom dimensions

searchDocs.title: 1. Start with Essential Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Don't request all columns at once. Start with what you need:  // ‚úÖ Good - only necessary columns { "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } // ‚ùå Excessive - too many columns { "keep": [ "allpv.pv_id", "allpv.session_id", "allpv.reader_id", "allpv.page_id", "allpv.url", "allpv.title", // ... 20 more columns ] }

searchDocs.title: 2. Use count_only to Check Data Volume‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Before fetching large datasets:  { "result": { "use": "my_view", "count_only": true } }

searchDocs.title: 3. Verify Column Names‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Check available columns using the materials endpoint:  curl -u "user:pass" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20"

searchDocs.title: 4. Understand Data Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Choose appropriate columns for your analysis:  Use pv_id or session_id for countingUse access_time for time-series analysisUse url or title for content analysisUse device_type/os/browser for device analysis

searchDocs.title: 5. Plan for Future Joins‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Even though joins aren't supported yet, keep in mind:  page_id links allpv and gscreader_id tracks visitors across sessionsThese will be useful when join functionality is added

searchDocs.title: Use Case 1: Traffic Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get basic traffic information:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time", "allpv.device_type" ] }

searchDocs.title: Use Case 2: SEO Analysis‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Analyze search performance:  { "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.url", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.position_wavg" ] }

searchDocs.title: Use Case 3: Campaign Tracking‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Track UTM campaigns:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.utm_source", "allpv.utm_medium", "allpv.utm_campaign", "allpv.access_time" ] }

searchDocs.title: Use Case 4: Device Analysis‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Analyze device usage:  { "keep": [ "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser", "allpv.url" ] }

searchDocs.title: API Endpoints Reference (2025-10-20)
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Endpoint Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Endpoint	Method	Purpose/qa-platform/guide	GET	Get API documentation and server info /qa-platform/query	POST	Execute QAL queries

searchDocs.title: 1. GET /qa-platform/guide‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Retrieves API documentation and comprehensive server information including available sites, materials, goals, and system limits.

searchDocs.title: Request‚Äã
searchDocs.content: URL:  GET /wp-json/qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20   Parameters:  Parameter	Type	Required	Descriptionversion	string	No	API version (default: oldest stable)  Authentication: Required (WordPress Application Password)

searchDocs.title: Response‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Returns comprehensive server information including:  API version and timestampAvailable tracking sites with their configurationsMaterial availability and data ranges per siteGoal definitions per siteSystem limits and quotasDocumentation content  { "version": "2025-10-20", "timestamp": "2025-10-06T12:34:56Z", "plugin_version": "3.0.0.0", "sites": [ { "tracking_id": "abc123", "domain": "example.com", "name": "„Ç≥„Éº„Éù„É¨„Éº„Éà„Çµ„Ç§„Éà", "default": true, "data_available_from": "2024-01-01", "timezone": "Asia/Tokyo", "goals": [ { "id": 1, "name": "„ÅäÂïè„ÅÑÂêà„Çè„ÅõÂÆå‰∫Ü", "type": "url_match", "condition": "/thanks/" }, { "id": 2, "name": "Ë≥áÊñô„ÉÄ„Ç¶„É≥„É≠„Éº„Éâ", "type": "click", "condition": ".download-btn" } ], "materials": { "allpv": { "available": true, "row_count": 1250000, "date_range": { "start": "2024-01-01", "end": "2025-10-06" } }, "gsc": { "available": true, "row_count": 45000, "date_range": { "start": "2024-03-01", "end": "2025-10-03" } } } }, { "tracking_id": "def456", "domain": "blog.example.com", "name": "„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞„Çµ„Ç§„Éà", "default": false, "data_available_from": "2024-06-01", "timezone": "Asia/Tokyo", "goals": [ { "id": 1, "name": "Ë®ò‰∫ãË™≠‰∫Ü", "type": "scroll_depth", "condition": "90" } ], "materials": { "allpv": { "available": true, "row_count": 320000, "date_range": { "start": "2024-06-01", "end": "2025-10-06" } }, "gsc": { "available": false } } } ], "summary": { "total_sites": 2, "total_pv": 1570000, "oldest_data": "2024-01-01", "newest_data": "2025-10-06" }, "limits": { "max_query_rows": 50000, "max_inline_rows": 5000, "query_timeout_seconds": 300 }, "documentation": { "source": "https://github.com/quarka-org/docs.qazero.com/tree/main/docs/developer-manual/api/2025-10-20", "format": "markdown", "sections": [ { "category": "overview", "file": "index.md", "title": "Getting Started", "content": "# QA ZERO API - Getting Started..." }, { "category": "reference", "file": "endpoints.md", "title": "API Endpoints", "content": "# API Endpoints Reference..." }, { "category": "reference", "file": "materials.md", "title": "Materials Reference", "content": "# Materials Reference..." }, { "category": "reference", "file": "qal.md", "title": "QAL Guide", "content": "# QAL Guide..." } ] } }

searchDocs.title: Response Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Root Level:  version - API version usedtimestamp - Current server time (ISO 8601)plugin_version - QA Platform plugin version (e.g., "3.0.0.0")  sites[] - Site Configurations:  tracking_id - Unique identifier for the tracking sitedomain - Primary domainname - Display namedefault - Whether this is the default site for queriesdata_available_from - Earliest available data datetimezone - Default timezone (IANA format)  sites[].goals[] - Goal Definitions:  id - Goal ID (1-10)name - Goal display nametype - Goal type (url_match, click, scroll_depth, etc.)condition - Goal trigger condition  sites[].materials - Material Availability:  available - Whether this material is availablerow_count - Approximate number of rowsdate_range - Available date range  summary - Overall Statistics:  total_sites - Number of tracking sitestotal_pv - Total page views across all sitesoldest_data - Oldest available data datenewest_data - Newest available data date  limits - System Limits:  max_query_rows - Maximum rows a query can processmax_inline_rows - Maximum rows returned inlinequery_timeout_seconds - Query timeout limit  documentation - API Documentation:  source - GitHub repository URLformat - Documentation formatsections[] - Documentation sections with content

searchDocs.title: Examples‚Äã
searchDocs.content: cURL:  curl -u "username:password" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20"   JavaScript:  const auth = btoa('username:password'); fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20', { headers: { 'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}` } }) .then(res => res.json()) .then(data => { console.log('API Version:', data.version); console.log('Plugin Version:', data.plugin_version); console.log('Available sites:', data.sites.length); console.log('Total PV:', data.summary.total_pv); data.sites.forEach(site => { console.log(`${site.name}: ${site.domain}`); console.log(' Materials:', Object.keys(site.materials)); console.log(' Goals:', site.goals.length); }); });   Python:  import requests from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth response = requests.get( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/guide', params={'version': '2025-10-20'}, auth=HTTPBasicAuth('username', 'password') ) data = response.json() print(f"API Version: {data['version']}") print(f"Plugin Version: {data['plugin_version']}") print(f"Total Sites: {data['summary']['total_sites']}") print(f"Total PV: {data['summary']['total_pv']}") for site in data['sites']: print(f"\n{site['name']} ({site['domain']})") print(f" Default: {site['default']}") print(f" Data from: {site['data_available_from']}") print(f" Goals: {len(site['goals'])}") for material, info in site['materials'].items(): if info['available']: print(f" {material}: {info['row_count']:,} rows")

searchDocs.title: Use Cases‚Äã
searchDocs.content: 1. Discover Available Materials:Check which materials are available for each site before querying.  2. Check Data Ranges:Determine the valid date range for your queries.  3. Find Goal IDs:Get goal IDs and conditions for goal-based queries (future versions).  4. Verify System Limits:Check max row limits before executing large queries.  5. Multi-Site Setup:Identify all tracking sites and their configurations.

searchDocs.title: Error Responses‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Invalid Version:  { "code": "invalid_version", "message": "Version '2024-01-01' not found", "data": { "status": 404, "available_versions": ["2025-10-20"] } }

searchDocs.title: 2. POST /qa-platform/query‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Executes a QAL query and returns results.

searchDocs.title: Request‚Äã
searchDocs.content: URL:  POST /wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20   Parameters:  Parameter	Type	Required	Descriptionversion	string	No	API version (default: oldest stable)  Authentication: Required  Headers:  Content-Type: application/json Authorization: Basic <credentials>   Body: JSON object with qal key containing the QAL query

searchDocs.title: Request Body Structure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The request body must be a JSON object with a qal key that contains the QAL query:  { "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "view_name": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, "result": { "use": "view_name", "limit": 100 } } }

searchDocs.title: QAL Query Structure (2025-10-20)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Note: API version is specified in the URL (?version=2025-10-20), not in the QAL query body.

searchDocs.title: Supported QAL Features (2025-10-20)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Required Fields:  tracking_id - Tracking site identifier (from /guide response)materials - Array of materials to usetime - Time range (start, end, tz)make - View definitionsresult - Result specification  make (View Definition):  ‚úÖ from - Source material (array with one element)‚úÖ keep - Columns to keep (fully qualified names)‚ùå join - Not supported in this version‚ùå filter - Not supported in this version‚ùå calc - Not supported in this version  result (Output Options):  ‚úÖ use - View name to return (required)‚úÖ limit - Maximum rows (default: 100, max: 5000)‚úÖ count_only - Return count instead of data (boolean)‚ùå sort - Not supported in this version‚ùå sample - Not supported in this version‚ùå return.mode - Not supported (INLINE only)‚ùå return.format - Not supported (JSON only)

searchDocs.title: Response Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Standard Response:  { "data": [ { "url": "https://example.com/page1", "title": "Page Title 1" }, { "url": "https://example.com/page2", "title": "Page Title 2" } ], "meta": { "truncated": false, "row_count": 2, "limits": { "row_limit": 5000 } } }   Count Only Response:  { "count": 12456 }   Response Fields:  Field	Type	Descriptiondata	array	Result rows (if not count_only) count	number	Row count (if count_only: true) meta.truncated	boolean	Whether results were limited meta.row_count	number	Number of rows returned meta.limits.row_limit	number	Maximum allowed rows

searchDocs.title: Examples‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Example 1: Get Recent Page Views  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "recent": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time"] } }, "result": { "use": "recent", "limit": 10 } } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   Example 2: Get Mobile Device Page Views  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "mobile_pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser" ] } }, "result": { "use": "mobile_pvs", "limit": 50 } } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   Example 3: Count Total Page Views  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "all": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.pv_id"] } }, "result": { "use": "all", "count_only": true } } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   Example 4: GSC Keywords  curl -X POST \ -u "username:password" \ -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -d '{ "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "gsc"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "keywords": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr", "gsc.position_wavg" ] } }, "result": { "use": "keywords", "limit": 100 } } }' \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20"   JavaScript Example:  const auth = btoa('username:password'); const query = { qal: { tracking_id: "abc123", materials: [{name: "allpv"}], time: { start: "2025-10-01T00:00:00", end: "2025-10-20T00:00:00", tz: "Asia/Tokyo" }, make: { pvs: { from: ["allpv"], keep: ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, result: { use: "pvs", limit: 10 } } }; fetch('https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query?version=2025-10-20', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Authorization': `Basic ${auth}`, 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(query) }) .then(res => res.json()) .then(data => console.log(data));   Python Example:  import requests from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth query = { "qal": { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [{"name": "allpv"}], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.url", "allpv.title"] } }, "result": { "use": "pvs", "limit": 10 } } } response = requests.post( 'https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/query', params={'version': '2025-10-20'}, json=query, auth=HTTPBasicAuth('username', 'password') ) data = response.json() for row in data['data']: print(f"{row['url']}: {row['title']}")

searchDocs.title: Error Responses‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Invalid tracking_id:  { "code": "E_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID", "message": "Unknown tracking_id: 'invalid123'", "data": { "tracking_id": "invalid123", "available_sites": [ {"tracking_id": "abc123", "domain": "example.com"}, {"tracking_id": "def456", "domain": "blog.example.com"} ] } }   Invalid Material:  { "code": "E_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL", "message": "Unknown material: 'unknown'", "data": { "material": "unknown", "available_materials": ["allpv", "gsc"] } }   Invalid Column:  { "code": "E_UNKNOWN_COLUMN", "message": "Unknown column: allpv.invalid_col", "data": { "material": "allpv", "column": "invalid_col" } }   Missing Time:  { "code": "E_TIME_REQUIRED", "message": "Missing required field: time", "data": { "field": "time", "required_fields": ["start", "end", "tz"] } }   Unsupported Feature:  { "code": "E_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED", "message": "Feature 'filter' is not supported in version 2025-10-20", "data": { "feature": "filter", "version": "2025-10-20", "available_in": "future versions" } }

searchDocs.title: Rate Limiting‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Default rate limits:  100 requests per hour per user10 requests per minute (burst)  Headers included in response:  X-RateLimit-Limit: 100 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 95 X-RateLimit-Reset: 1729468800

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Always specify version in productionUse /guide endpoint to discover available materials and data rangesUse count_only for checking data volume before fetchingStart with small limits (10-100 rows) for testingCheck server limits from /guide responseImplement retry logic with exponential backoffCheck meta.truncated to know if results were limited

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Purpose: Single source of truth for QAL validation rulesVersion: 2025-10-20Type: validation_manifestAudience: QAL Executor (PHP), AI Models (ChatGPT, Claude, MCP), Human Documentation

searchDocs.title: Validation Manifest (AI-Readable Copy)‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: id: qal-validation-2025-10-20 title: QAL Validation Manifest (for Executor and AI) version: "2025-10-20" update: "2025-10-20" type: validation_manifest description: > Defines strict validation rules for QAL JSON execution requests. Used for validating QAL structures before execution. structure: required: ["tracking_id", "materials", "time", "make", "result"] rules: tracking_id: type: string description: "Unique identifier for the tracking site to query. Must match a tracking_id from the /guide endpoint response." pattern: "^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$" errors: - code: E_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID message: "Invalid tracking_id provided." materials: type: array description: "List of data sources (materials) to use in the query. Each material must have a 'name' property." items: type: object required: ["name"] properties: name: type: string description: "Material name. Only 'allpv' (page view data) and 'gsc' (Google Search Console data) are allowed." enum: ["allpv", "gsc"] additionalProperties: false minItems: 1 errors: - code: E_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL message: "Material name not found in manifest." time: type: object required: ["start", "end", "tz"] properties: start: { type: string, format: date-time } end: { type: string, format: date-time } tz: type: string description: "IANA timezone identifier (e.g., Asia/Tokyo, UTC, America/New_York). Any valid IANA timezone is accepted." examples: ["Asia/Tokyo", "UTC", "Europe/London", "America/New_York", "America/Los_Angeles", "Europe/Paris"] errors: - code: E_TIME_REQUIRED message: "Missing time.start, time.end, or time.tz." make: type: object description: "Defines views (data transformations) to create from materials. Each key is a view name, and the value defines the view's structure." patternProperties: "^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$": type: object description: "View definition. Must specify 'from' (source material) and 'keep' (columns to select)." required: ["from", "keep"] properties: from: type: array description: "Specify which material to use. Must contain exactly one material name." items: { type: string, enum: ["allpv", "gsc"] } minItems: 1 maxItems: 1 keep: type: array description: "List of columns to include in the result. Must use fully qualified names in the format 'material.column_name' (e.g., 'allpv.url', 'gsc.keyword')." items: type: string pattern: "^(allpv|gsc)\\.[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$" minItems: 1 additionalProperties: false errors: - code: E_UNKNOWN_COLUMN message: "Invalid column name in keep list." result: type: object description: "Specifies which view to return and how to format the result." required: ["use"] properties: use: type: string description: "Name of the view (defined in 'make') to return as the result." limit: type: integer description: "Maximum number of rows to return. Default: 1000, Maximum: 50000." minimum: 1 maximum: 50000 default: 1000 count_only: type: boolean description: "If true, return only the count of rows instead of the actual data. Default: false." default: false additionalProperties: false errors: - code: E_UNKNOWN_VIEW message: "Result.use does not match any defined view in make." features: filter: false join: false calc: false sort: false

searchDocs.title: How to Use‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version

searchDocs.title: For AI Models (ChatGPT, Claude, MCP)‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: You are a QAL Generator.  Your task is to produce valid QAL JSON objects that conform to this schema:  Always include these required sections: tracking_id - string matching ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$materials - array with at least one material (allpv or gsc)time - object with start, end, and tzmake - object with at least one view definitionresult - object with use (required), optional limit and count_only Follow these rules: Only use materials: allpv, gsc (strictly limited)Use any valid IANA timezone (examples: Asia/Tokyo, UTC, Europe/London, America/New_York, America/Los_Angeles, Europe/Paris)Column names must be fully qualified: material.columnEach view in make must have exactly ONE item in from arrayresult.use must reference a view name defined in makeresult.limit must be 1-50000 (default: 1000) Do NOT use these features (disabled in this version): filter - Not supportedjoin - Not supportedcalc - Not supportedsort - Not supported

searchDocs.title: For QAL Executor (PHP)‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Runtime Validation:  <?php // Load validation manifest $manifest = yaml_parse_file('/path/to/qal-validation.md'); // Validate QAL JSON $result = QAL_Executor::qal_validate_by_manifest($qal_json, $manifest); if (!$result['valid']) { // Return validation errors return [ 'success' => false, 'errors' => $result['errors'] ]; } // Proceed with execution   Validation Steps:  Structure validation - Check all required top-level keys existtracking_id validation - Verify format and existencematerials validation - Check material names are validtime validation - Validate datetime format and timezonemake validation - Verify view structure, from, and keep rulesresult validation - Check use references valid view, limit is in rangeFeature check - Reject any disabled features (filter, join, calc, sort)

searchDocs.title: For Human Documentation (Docusaurus)‚Äã

searchDocs.content: This page is rendered as part of the API documentation. The YAML frontmatter is parsed by Docusaurus, and this markdown body provides human-readable guidance. searchDocs.title: Validation Rules Details‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version

searchDocs.title: 1. tracking_id‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Type: stringPattern: ^[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+$Error Code: E_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID  Valid Examples:  {"tracking_id": "abc123"} {"tracking_id": "site-001"} {"tracking_id": "my_tracking_id"}   Invalid Examples:  {"tracking_id": ""} // Empty {"tracking_id": "abc 123"} // Contains space {"tracking_id": "abc@123"} // Contains special char

searchDocs.title: 2. materials‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Type: array of objectsMin Items: 1Allowed Values: allpv, gscError Code: E_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL  Valid Examples:  { "materials": [ {"name": "allpv"} ] }   { "materials": [ {"name": "allpv"}, {"name": "gsc"} ] }   Invalid Examples:  { "materials": [] // Empty array }   { "materials": [ {"name": "unknown"} // Invalid material name ] }   { "materials": [ {"name": "allpv", "as": "pv"} // additionalProperties not allowed ] }

searchDocs.title: 3. time‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Type: objectRequired Fields: start, end, tzError Code: E_TIME_REQUIRED  Valid Example:  { "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" } }   Timezone (tz):  Type: StringFormat: IANA timezone identifierAny valid IANA timezone is accepted (see IANA Time Zone Database)Common examples: Asia/Tokyo - Japan Standard TimeUTC - Coordinated Universal TimeEurope/London - UKAmerica/New_York - US EasternAmerica/Los_Angeles - US PacificEurope/Paris - Central European TimeAustralia/Sydney - Australian Eastern Time  Invalid Examples:  { "time": { "start": "2025-10-01", // Missing time component "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" } }   { "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "JST" // Use IANA format like "Asia/Tokyo", not abbreviations } }   { "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Tokyo" // Must use full IANA identifier "Asia/Tokyo" } }

searchDocs.title: 4. make‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Type: objectPattern: View names must match ^[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$Error Code: E_UNKNOWN_COLUMN  Structure:  Each view must have from (array with exactly 1 material)Each view must have keep (array with at least 1 column)Column names must match ^(allpv|gsc)\.[a-zA-Z0-9_]+$  Valid Example:  { "make": { "page_views": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time" ] } } }   Invalid Examples:  { "make": { "page_views": { "from": ["allpv", "gsc"], // More than 1 item "keep": ["allpv.url"] } } }   { "make": { "page_views": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["url"] // Not fully qualified } } }   { "make": { "page_views": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [] // Empty keep array } } }

searchDocs.title: 5. result‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Type: objectRequired: useOptional: limit (1-50000, default: 1000), count_only (boolean, default: false)Error Code: E_UNKNOWN_VIEW  Valid Examples:  { "result": { "use": "page_views" } }   { "result": { "use": "page_views", "limit": 100, "count_only": false } }   { "result": { "use": "page_views", "count_only": true } }   Invalid Examples:  { "result": { "use": "nonexistent_view" // View not defined in make } }   { "result": { "use": "page_views", "limit": 100000 // Exceeds maximum of 50000 } }   { "result": { "use": "page_views", "limit": 0 // Below minimum } }

searchDocs.title: Error Codes Reference‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: Error Code	Field	Cause	SolutionE_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID	tracking_id	Invalid or missing tracking_id	Use tracking_id from /guide endpoint E_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL	materials	Invalid material name	Use only allpv or gsc E_TIME_REQUIRED	time	Missing start, end, or tz	Include all three fields E_UNKNOWN_COLUMN	make.*.keep	Invalid column name	Use fully qualified names (material.column) E_UNKNOWN_VIEW	result.use	View name doesn't exist in make	Reference a view defined in make E_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED	Various	Used disabled feature	Remove filter, join, calc, or sort

searchDocs.title: Design Principles‚Äã

searchDocs.title: 1. Single Source of Truth‚Äã

searchDocs.content: Both the PHP executor and AI models read the same schema definition. This ensures consistency between validation and generation.

searchDocs.title: 4. AI-Friendly Structure‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Validation Function‚Äã
searchDocs.pageTitle: QAL Validation Manifest ‚Äî AI Accessible Version
searchDocs.content: <?php class QAL_Executor { public static function qal_validate_by_manifest($qal_json, $manifest) { $errors = []; // 1. Check required structure foreach ($manifest['structure']['required'] as $field) { if (!isset($qal_json[$field])) { $errors[] = "Missing required field: $field"; } } // 2. Validate tracking_id if (isset($qal_json['tracking_id'])) { $pattern = $manifest['rules']['tracking_id']['pattern']; if (!preg_match("/$pattern/", $qal_json['tracking_id'])) { $errors[] = $manifest['rules']['tracking_id']['errors'][0]['message']; } } // 3. Validate materials if (isset($qal_json['materials'])) { $allowed = $manifest['rules']['materials']['items']['properties']['name']['enum']; foreach ($qal_json['materials'] as $material) { if (!in_array($material['name'], $allowed)) { $errors[] = $manifest['rules']['materials']['errors'][0]['message']; } } } // ... more validation steps return [ 'valid' => empty($errors), 'errors' => $errors ]; } }

searchDocs.title: QA ZERO Architecture
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: System Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO consists of several key components:  Core Tracking System: JavaScript code that collects user interaction dataData Storage: File-based and database storage for collected dataData Processing: Background processes that analyze and aggregate dataAdmin Interface: WordPress admin panels for viewing analytics and configuring the system

searchDocs.title: Core Tracking System‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The tracking system is implemented as JavaScript that is injected into WordPress pages. It:  Captures page views, clicks, scrolls, and other user interactionsSends data to the server via AJAX callsHandles user consent and privacy settings

searchDocs.title: Data Storage‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO uses a hybrid storage approach:  Raw data is stored in files in the wp-content/qa-zero-data directoryProcessed data is stored in WordPress database tablesSession recordings are stored as compressed JSON files

searchDocs.title: Data Processing‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Data processing is primarily handled by WordPress cron jobs that:  Aggregate raw data into meaningful metricsGenerate heatmaps from click and scroll dataCalculate conversion rates and other KPIs

searchDocs.title: Admin Interface‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The admin interface is integrated into the WordPress admin panel and provides:  Dashboard widgets for quick insightsDetailed reports and visualizationsConfiguration options for tracking and privacy settings

searchDocs.title: Data Flow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: User visits a page with QA ZERO tracking codeJavaScript collects interaction dataData is sent to the server via AJAXRaw data is stored in filesCron jobs process the raw dataProcessed data is stored in the databaseAdmin interface displays the processed data

searchDocs.title: Coming Soon‚Äã
searchDocs.content: More detailed architecture documentation will be added in future updates.

searchDocs.title: QAL Guide (2025-10-20)
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This version of QAL (Query Abstraction Language) provides a simplified subset focused on basic data extraction. It's designed to be easy to learn and use while maintaining clarity and safety.  Version: 2025-10-20

searchDocs.title: What's Supported‚Äã
searchDocs.content: ‚úÖ Basic extraction - Select specific columns from materials ‚úÖ Time filtering - Filter by date/time range ‚úÖ Simple results - Return data or count  ‚ùå Not yet available:  Row filtering (filter)Joining materials (join)Aggregations (calc)Sorting (sort)Sampling

searchDocs.title: Document Structure‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Every QAL query has four required sections:  { "tracking_id": "abc123", "materials": [ /* data sources */ ], "time": { /* time range */ }, "make": { /* view definitions */ }, "result": { /* result specification */ } }   Note: Version is specified in the URL query parameter (?version=2025-10-20), not in the QAL query body.

searchDocs.title: 1. tracking_id (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Specify which tracking site to query. Use the tracking_id from the /guide endpoint response.  { "tracking_id": "abc123" }   Rules:  Must match a tracking_id from /guide responseDetermines which site's data to queryEach site may have different available materialsUse /guide endpoint to discover available tracking IDs  Example:  {"tracking_id": "abc123"} // ‚úÖ Valid site ID {"tracking_id": "def456"} // ‚úÖ Another site {"tracking_id": "invalid"} // ‚ùå Unknown site   Finding Your tracking_id:  curl -u "user:pass" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/guide?version=2025-10-20"   Look for sites[].tracking_id in the response.

searchDocs.title: 2. materials (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: List the materials (data sources) you want to use.

searchDocs.title: Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ] }

searchDocs.title: Available Materials‚Äã
searchDocs.content: allpv - Page view datagsc - Google Search Console data

searchDocs.title: Rules‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Each material must have a name propertyName must be exact (case-sensitive)‚ùå No as (aliasing) allowedCan declare multiple materials (even if using only one)

searchDocs.title: Examples‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Single material:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ] }   Multiple materials (for future use):  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" }, { "name": "gsc" } ] }

searchDocs.title: 3. time (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Define the time range for your query.

searchDocs.title: Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" } }

searchDocs.title: Fields‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Field	Type	Required	Descriptionstart	string	Yes	Start time (ISO 8601) end	string	Yes	End time (ISO 8601) tz	string	Yes	IANA timezone

searchDocs.title: Time Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use ISO 8601 local time format:  YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss   Examples:  2025-10-01T00:00:00 - October 1, 2025 at midnight2025-10-20T23:59:59 - October 20, 2025 at 11:59:59 PM

searchDocs.title: Timezones‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Common timezone values:  Asia/Tokyo - JapanAmerica/New_York - US EasternAmerica/Los_Angeles - US PacificEurope/London - UKUTC - Coordinated Universal Time  Full list: IANA Timezone Database

searchDocs.title: Time Range Interpretation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Inclusive start: Data from start time is includedExclusive end: Data from end time is excludedThink of it as: [start, end)  Example:  { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-02T00:00:00" }   Returns all data from October 1st, but nothing from October 2nd.

searchDocs.title: 4. make (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Define views to transform your data.

searchDocs.title: Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "make": { "view_name": { "from": ["material_name"], "keep": ["material.column1", "material.column2"] } } }

searchDocs.title: View Name‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The key in make is your view name:  Can be any valid stringUse descriptive names (e.g., recent_pvs, mobile_data)Will be referenced in result.use

searchDocs.title: from (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Specify which material to use.  Format:  { "from": ["allpv"] }   Rules:  Must be an array with exactly one elementElement must match a material declared in materialsIn this version, can only reference materials (not other views)  Examples:  {"from": ["allpv"]} // ‚úÖ Correct {"from": ["gsc"]} // ‚úÖ Correct {"from": ["allpv", "gsc"]} // ‚ùå Wrong - only one allowed {"from": "allpv"} // ‚ùå Wrong - must be array

searchDocs.title: keep (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: List the columns you want in your result.  Format:  { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time" ] }   Rules:  Must use fully qualified names: material.columnAt least one column requiredOrder in keep determines column order in resultsUnknown columns will cause an error  Examples:  // ‚úÖ Correct { "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title" ] } // ‚ùå Wrong - not qualified { "keep": ["url", "title"] } // ‚ùå Wrong - wrong material name { "keep": ["wrong.url"] }

searchDocs.title: Complete make Example‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "make": { "page_views": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.access_time" ] } } }

searchDocs.title: 5. result (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Specify which view to return and how.

searchDocs.title: Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: { "result": { "use": "view_name", "limit": 1000, "count_only": false } }

searchDocs.title: use (required)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Name of the view (from make) to return.  { "use": "page_views" }   Rules:  Must match a view name defined in makeOnly ONE view can be returned

searchDocs.title: limit (optional)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Maximum number of rows to return.  { "limit": 1000 }   Rules:  Default: 1000Maximum: 50000Values above 50000 will be capped at 50000  Examples:  {"limit": 10} // Return up to 10 rows {"limit": 1000} // Default value {"limit": 10000} // Return up to 10000 rows {"limit": 50000} // Maximum allowed

searchDocs.title: count_only (optional)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Return only the count instead of data.  { "count_only": true }   Rules:  Default: falseWhen true, returns only {count: N}When false, returns full data array  Examples:  // Get data { "use": "page_views", "limit": 1000, "count_only": false } // Returns: {"data": [...], "meta": {...}} // Get count only { "use": "page_views", "count_only": true } // Returns: {"count": 12456}

searchDocs.title: Example 1: Basic Page View Query‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get the most recent 10 page views with URL and title:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "recent_views": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.access_time" ] } }, "result": { "use": "recent_views", "limit": 10 } }

searchDocs.title: Example 2: Device and Browser Info‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get device and browser information:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "device_info": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser" ] } }, "result": { "use": "device_info", "limit": 1000 } }

searchDocs.title: Example 3: Count Total Page Views‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get the count without retrieving data:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "all_pvs": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": ["allpv.pv_id"] } }, "result": { "use": "all_pvs", "count_only": true } }   Response:  { "count": 15234 }

searchDocs.title: Example 4: UTM Campaign Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get UTM campaign information:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "campaign_data": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.url", "allpv.utm_source", "allpv.utm_medium", "allpv.utm_campaign" ] } }, "result": { "use": "campaign_data", "limit": 200 } }

searchDocs.title: Example 5: GSC Keywords‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get Google Search Console keywords:  { "materials": [ { "name": "gsc" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "keywords": { "from": ["gsc"], "keep": [ "gsc.keyword", "gsc.url", "gsc.clicks_sum", "gsc.impressions_sum", "gsc.ctr", "gsc.position_wavg" ] } }, "result": { "use": "keywords", "limit": 1000 } }

searchDocs.title: Example 6: New vs Returning Visitors‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get new user flag information:  { "materials": [ { "name": "allpv" } ], "time": { "start": "2025-10-01T00:00:00", "end": "2025-10-20T00:00:00", "tz": "Asia/Tokyo" }, "make": { "visitor_type": { "from": ["allpv"], "keep": [ "allpv.reader_id", "allpv.is_newuser", "allpv.access_time" ] } }, "result": { "use": "visitor_type", "limit": 500 } }

searchDocs.title: Error Codes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Common errors you might encounter:  Error Code	Cause	SolutionE_UNKNOWN_TRACKING_ID	Invalid tracking_id	Use tracking_id from /guide endpoint E_TIME_REQUIRED	Missing time fields	Add start, end, and tz E_UNKNOWN_MATERIAL	Invalid material name	Use "allpv" or "gsc" E_UNKNOWN_COLUMN	Invalid column name	Check materials reference E_UNKNOWN_VIEW	result.use references non-existent view	Match view name in make E_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED	Used unsupported feature	Remove filter/join/calc

searchDocs.title: Pattern 1: Check Data Volume First‚Äã
searchDocs.content: // Step 1: Count how many rows { "result": { "use": "my_view", "count_only": true } } // Step 2: If count is reasonable, get the data { "result": { "use": "my_view", "limit": 1000 } }

searchDocs.title: Pattern 2: Incremental Limits‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Start small, then increase:  // Test with 10 {"limit": 10} // If okay, try 100 {"limit": 100} // If okay, get more {"limit": 1000}

searchDocs.title: Pattern 3: All Available Columns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To see all data available:  { "keep": [ "allpv.pv_id", "allpv.session_id", "allpv.reader_id", "allpv.page_id", "allpv.url", "allpv.title", "allpv.device_type", "allpv.os", "allpv.browser", "allpv.access_time", "allpv.utm_source", "allpv.utm_medium", "allpv.utm_campaign" // ... add more as needed ] }

searchDocs.title: 1. Start Simple‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Begin with a minimal query:  { "keep": ["allpv.url"] }   Then add more columns as needed.

searchDocs.title: 2. Use Descriptive View Names‚Äã
searchDocs.content: // ‚úÖ Good {"blog_posts": {...}} {"mobile_users": {...}} // ‚ùå Not helpful {"view1": {...}} {"data": {...}}

searchDocs.title: 3. Test with Small Limits‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Always test with limit: 10 first:  { "result": { "use": "my_view", "limit": 10 } }

searchDocs.title: 4. Check Column Names‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use /materials endpoint to verify column names before querying:  curl -u "user:pass" \ "https://your-site.com/wp-json/qa-platform/materials?version=2025-10-20"

searchDocs.title: 5. Use count_only for Planning‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Before fetching large datasets:  { "result": { "use": "my_view", "count_only": true } }

searchDocs.title: What's Coming in Future Versions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Planned features for future releases:  filter - Row-level filtering (e.g., only mobile devices)join - Combine multiple materialscalc - Aggregations (COUNT, SUM, AVERAGE, etc.)sort - Sort results by columnCSV/Parquet export - Alternative output formatsMore materials - Additional data sources

searchDocs.title: Comparison with Full QAL‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This version implements a minimal subset of QAL:  Feature	2025-10-20	Future Versionsmaterials	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ time	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ make.from	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ make.keep	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ make.filter	‚ùå Not yet	‚úÖ Planned make.join	‚ùå Not yet	‚úÖ Planned make.calc	‚ùå Not yet	‚úÖ Planned result.use	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ result.limit	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ result.count_only	‚úÖ Supported	‚úÖ result.sort	‚ùå Not yet	‚úÖ Planned result.return (CSV)	‚ùå Not yet	‚úÖ Planned

searchDocs.title: API Documentation Version Management
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Version Format‚Äã
searchDocs.content: API Version: YYYY-MM-DD (Calendar versioning) Documentation Version: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH (Semantic versioning)

searchDocs.title: 1. When Making Documentation Changes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Update the last_updated field in the frontmatter of modified files:  --- id: getting-started-2025-10-20 title: Getting Started sidebar_position: 1 last_updated: 2025-10-06 # ‚Üê Update this date ---

searchDocs.title: 2. Update Changelog‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add entries to the Changelog section in index.md:  ### YYYY-MM-DD - Documentation vX.Y.Z **Added:** - ‚úÖ New feature description **Removed:** - ‚ùå Deprecated feature **Changed:** - üîÑ Modified feature

searchDocs.title: 3. Documentation Version Bumping‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Follow semantic versioning for documentation:  MAJOR (1.0.0 ‚Üí 2.0.0): Breaking changes in documentation structureMINOR (1.0.0 ‚Üí 1.1.0): New content added (new sections, endpoints, features)PATCH (1.0.0 ‚Üí 1.0.1): Fixes, clarifications, typo corrections

searchDocs.title: Current Versions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: API Version	Doc Version	Status	Released	Support Until2025-10-20	1.0.0	Current	2025-10-20	2027-10-20

searchDocs.title: Frontmatter (Machine-readable)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: All .md files in /developer/api/2025-10-20/ contain:  last_updated: YYYY-MM-DD

searchDocs.title: Changelog (Human-readable)‚Äã
searchDocs.content: /developer/api/2025-10-20/index.md - Contains full changelog

searchDocs.title: Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.content: docusaurus.config.js - Enables showLastUpdateTime: true

searchDocs.title: How It Works‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Frontmatter last_updated: Docusaurus reads this fieldGenerates new build with updated timestampsCDN/browser cache keys change automatically Info Box: Visible version info at top of Getting Started pageShows both API and Documentation versions Changelog Section: Detailed change historyHelps users understand what changed

searchDocs.title: For CDN/Cache Systems‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The last_updated field in frontmatter affects:  Build output filenames (Docusaurus hash)Metadata sent to clientsCDN cache invalidation triggers

searchDocs.title: Example Update Flow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: # 1. Make documentation changes vim developer/api/2025-10-20/endpoints.md # 2. Update frontmatter # Change: last_updated: 2025-10-06 # 3. Update changelog in index.md # Add entry under "### 2025-10-06 - Documentation v1.0.1" # 4. Rebuild npm run build # 5. Deploy # New hashed files automatically bust cache

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Always update last_updated when modifying contentUse consistent date format: YYYY-MM-DDKeep changelog detailed but conciseGroup related changes under single date entryUse emoji markers: ‚úÖ Added, ‚ùå Removed, üîÑ Changed

searchDocs.title: Monitoring Updates‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Users can:  Check Version Information box at top of Getting StartedReview Changelog section for detailsSee "Last updated" timestamp at bottom of each page (Docusaurus feature)  Systems can:  Parse last_updated from frontmatterMonitor file hashes in build outputTrack version numbers in Info box

searchDocs.title: DNS Setup Instructions for docs.qazero.com
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Prerequisites‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Access to your domain's DNS settings (typically through your domain registrar)GitHub Pages site already deployed

searchDocs.title: 1. Configure GitHub Pages‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The repository is already configured to use the custom domain through:  A CNAME file in the repository with docs.qazero.comGitHub Pages settings in the repository settings

searchDocs.title: 2. DNS Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To point your domain to GitHub Pages, you need to add the following DNS records:  Option 1: Apex Domain Configuration (Recommended)‚Äã  If you're using the apex domain (docs.qazero.com), add these A records:  Type	Host	Value	TTLA	@	185.199.108.153	3600 A	@	185.199.109.153	3600 A	@	185.199.110.153	3600 A	@	185.199.111.153	3600  Option 2: Subdomain Configuration‚Äã  If docs.qazero.com is a subdomain, add a CNAME record:  Type	Host	Value	TTLCNAME	docs	quarka-org.github.io	3600

searchDocs.title: 3. Verify DNS Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After configuring your DNS records:  Wait for DNS propagation (can take up to 48 hours, but often completes within a few hours)Verify the configuration using: dig docs.qazero.com +noall +answer Check that the site is accessible at https://docs.qazero.com

searchDocs.title: 4. Enforce HTTPS‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once the DNS is properly configured:  Go to the GitHub repository settingsNavigate to Pages settingsCheck the "Enforce HTTPS" option

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If the domain is not working correctly:  Verify DNS records are correctly configuredCheck that the CNAME file exists in the repositoryEnsure GitHub Pages is enabled in repository settingsCheck for any error messages in the GitHub Pages section of repository settings

searchDocs.title: Tutorial Intro
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Getting Started‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Get started by creating a new site.  Or try Docusaurus immediately with docusaurus.new.

searchDocs.title: What you'll need‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Node.js version 18.0 or above: When installing Node.js, you are recommended to check all checkboxes related to dependencies.

searchDocs.title: Generate a new site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Generate a new Docusaurus site using the classic template.  The classic template will automatically be added to your project after you run the command:  npm init docusaurus@latest my-website classic   You can type this command into Command Prompt, Powershell, Terminal, or any other integrated terminal of your code editor.  The command also installs all necessary dependencies you need to run Docusaurus.

searchDocs.title: Start your site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Run the development server:  cd my-website npm run start   The cd command changes the directory you're working with. In order to work with your newly created Docusaurus site, you'll need to navigate the terminal there.  The npm run start command builds your website locally and serves it through a development server, ready for you to view at http://localhost:3000/.  Open docs/intro.md (this page) and edit some lines: the site reloads automatically and displays your changes.

searchDocs.title: General FAQ
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: What is QA ZERO?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is a WordPress plugin that provides analytics, heatmaps, and session recording functionality to help you understand how users interact with your website.

searchDocs.title: How does QA ZERO compare to Google Analytics?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: While Google Analytics provides comprehensive traffic data, QA ZERO focuses on user behavior and interaction. QA ZERO offers visual tools like heatmaps and session recordings that Google Analytics doesn't provide. Many users use both tools together for a complete picture of their website performance.

searchDocs.title: Does QA ZERO slow down my website?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is designed to have minimal impact on your website's performance. The tracking script is lightweight and loads asynchronously, meaning it doesn't block your page from loading.

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO GDPR compliant?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Yes, QA ZERO includes features to help you comply with GDPR and other privacy regulations, including:  Cookie consent integrationData anonymization optionsTools for handling data subject requestsData retention controls

searchDocs.title: Search Implementation Security Review
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Implementation Choice‚Äã
searchDocs.content: For the QA ZERO documentation site, we have implemented the docusaurus-lunr-search plugin (version 3.6.0+) as the primary search solution. This choice was made based on the following security considerations:

searchDocs.title: Security Considerations‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Client-side Search: The plugin performs all search operations on the client side, eliminating the need for external API calls or server-side processing. No External Dependencies: The search functionality does not rely on external services, reducing potential attack vectors and data leakage risks. No Data Collection: Unlike some search solutions that send queries to external servers, docusaurus-lunr-search keeps all search queries and indexes local to the user's browser. Open Source: The code is open source and has been reviewed by the community, increasing the likelihood that security issues are identified and addressed. Minimal JavaScript: The plugin uses a minimal amount of JavaScript, reducing the potential attack surface.

searchDocs.title: Code Audit Results‚Äã
searchDocs.content: We conducted a thorough code audit of the docusaurus-lunr-search plugin with the following findings:  No Suspicious Code: No suspicious or malicious code was identified in the plugin. No Unnecessary Network Requests: The plugin does not make any unnecessary network requests or transmit search data to external servers. No Sensitive Data Handling: The plugin does not handle or store sensitive user data. Proper Input Sanitization: The plugin properly sanitizes search inputs to prevent XSS attacks.

searchDocs.title: Version Management‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To ensure security and stability:  Fixed Version: The plugin is locked to a specific version in package.json to prevent automatic updates that might introduce security vulnerabilities. Regular Updates: A process is in place to regularly review updates to the plugin for security improvements while maintaining version control.

searchDocs.title: Multilingual Support‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The plugin has been configured to support both English and Japanese search, with proper handling of Japanese characters and tokenization.

searchDocs.title: Option 2: Basic Search Functionality‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The built-in basic search functionality of Docusaurus was considered as a fallback option. While secure, it offers limited functionality compared to the chosen solution.

searchDocs.title: Option 3: @easyops-cn/docusaurus-search-local‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This plugin was evaluated but not selected due to security concerns:  Less active maintenanceMore complex codebase with potential security issuesPotential for unnecessary external communications

searchDocs.title: Conclusion‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Based on our security review, docusaurus-lunr-search provides the best balance of functionality and security for the QA ZERO documentation site. The plugin operates entirely client-side, does not transmit data to external servers, and has been locked to a specific version to prevent security regressions from automatic updates.

searchDocs.title: Future Improvements‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Potential future improvements to search security include:  Regular security audits of the plugin as new versions are releasedConsideration of implementing Content Security Policy (CSP) headers to further restrict potential script executionMonitoring for any security advisories related to the Lunr.js library that powers the search functionality

searchDocs.title: Create your first Doc‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Configure the Sidebar‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus automatically creates a sidebar from the docs folder.  Add metadata to customize the sidebar label and position:  docs/hello.md --- sidebar_label: 'Hi!' sidebar_position: 3 --- # Hello This is my **first Docusaurus document**!   It is also possible to create your sidebar explicitly in sidebars.js:  sidebars.js export default { tutorialSidebar: [ 'intro', 'hello', { type: 'category', label: 'Tutorial', items: ['tutorial-basics/create-a-document'], }, ], };

searchDocs.title: Manage Docs Versions

searchDocs.title: Create a docs version‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Release a version 1.0 of your project:  npm run docusaurus docs:version 1.0   The docs folder is copied into versioned_docs/version-1.0 and versions.json is created.  Your docs now have 2 versions:  1.0 at http://localhost:3000/docs/ for the version 1.0 docscurrent at http://localhost:3000/docs/next/ for the upcoming, unreleased docs

searchDocs.title: Add a Version Dropdown‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To navigate seamlessly across versions, add a version dropdown.  Modify the docusaurus.config.js file:  docusaurus.config.js export default { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'docsVersionDropdown', }, ], }, }, };   The docs version dropdown appears in your navbar:

searchDocs.title: Update an existing version‚Äã
searchDocs.content: It is possible to edit versioned docs in their respective folder:  versioned_docs/version-1.0/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/hellodocs/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/next/hello
