searchDocs.title: Translate your site
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Configure i18n‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Modify docusaurus.config.js to add support for the fr locale:  docusaurus.config.js export default { i18n: { defaultLocale: 'en', locales: ['en', 'fr'], }, };

searchDocs.title: Translate a doc‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Copy the docs/intro.md file to the i18n/fr folder:  mkdir -p i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/ cp docs/intro.md i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md   Translate i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md in French.

searchDocs.title: Start your localized site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Start your site on the French locale:  npm run start -- --locale fr   Your localized site is accessible at http://localhost:3000/fr/ and the Getting Started page is translated.  caution In development, you can only use one locale at a time.

searchDocs.title: Add a Locale Dropdown‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To navigate seamlessly across languages, add a locale dropdown.  Modify the docusaurus.config.js file:  docusaurus.config.js export default { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'localeDropdown', }, ], }, }, };   The locale dropdown now appears in your navbar:

searchDocs.title: Build your localized site‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Build your site for a specific locale:  npm run build -- --locale fr   Or build your site to include all the locales at once:  npm run build

searchDocs.title: Front Matter‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Markdown documents have metadata at the top called Front Matter:  my-doc.md --- id: my-doc-id title: My document title description: My document description slug: /my-custom-url --- ## Markdown heading Markdown text with [links](./hello.md)

searchDocs.title: Links‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Regular Markdown links are supported, using url paths or relative file paths.  Let's see how to [Create a page](/create-a-page).   Let's see how to [Create a page](./create-a-page.md).   Result: Let's see how to Create a page.

searchDocs.title: Images‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Regular Markdown images are supported.  You can use absolute paths to reference images in the static directory (static/img/docusaurus.png):  ![Docusaurus logo](/img/docusaurus.png)     You can reference images relative to the current file as well. This is particularly useful to colocate images close to the Markdown files using them:  ![Docusaurus logo](./img/docusaurus.png)

searchDocs.title: Code Blocks‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Markdown code blocks are supported with Syntax highlighting.  ```jsx title="src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js" function HelloDocusaurus() { return <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1>; } ```   src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js function HelloDocusaurus() { return <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1>; }

searchDocs.title: Admonitions‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus has a special syntax to create admonitions and callouts:  :::tip[My tip] Use this awesome feature option ::: :::danger[Take care] This action is dangerous :::   My tip Use this awesome feature option  Take care This action is dangerous

searchDocs.title: MDX and React Components‚Äã
searchDocs.content: MDX can make your documentation more interactive and allows using any React components inside Markdown:  export const Highlight = ({children, color}) => ( <span style={{ backgroundColor: color, borderRadius: '20px', color: '#fff', padding: '10px', cursor: 'pointer', }} onClick={() => { alert(`You clicked the color ${color} with label ${children}`) }}> {children} </span> ); This is <Highlight color="#25c2a0">Docusaurus green</Highlight> ! This is <Highlight color="#1877F2">Facebook blue</Highlight> !     This is Docusaurus green !  This is Facebook blue !

searchDocs.title: Introduction to QA ZERO
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: What is QA ZERO?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is an independent analytics server solution that uses WordPress as middleware for easy installation and management. While it's distributed as a WordPress plugin for convenience, QA ZERO functions as a standalone analytics server that provides comprehensive website analytics without relying on cookies.  Unlike traditional WordPress plugins that extend WordPress functionality, QA ZERO uses WordPress primarily as an installation framework and management interface. This approach simplifies deployment while providing powerful analytics capabilities that operate independently of WordPress's core functions.

searchDocs.title: Key Features‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Independent Analytics Server: QA ZERO operates as a standalone analytics solution, with WordPress serving as the deployment and management layer.100% Cookieless Tracking: Capture meaningful analytics without using cookies or personal identifiers.Self-hosted by Default: Own your data. QA ZERO runs entirely on your infrastructure ‚Äî no external servers required.AI-powered Insights (Optional): Enhance your analytics with optional AI agents for insights and automation.Heatmap & Session Recording: Visualize user behavior and replay actual user journeys.Conversion Goal Tracking: Define and monitor important user actions on your site.Fast, Lightweight, and Privacy-first: Built with performance and compliance in mind.

searchDocs.title: Architecture Overview‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO consists of three main components:  WordPress Integration Layer: Handles installation, configuration, and provides the management interface.Analytics Server Core: The independent engine that processes and analyzes visitor data.Data Collection Scripts: Lightweight JavaScript that captures user interactions on your website.  This architecture allows QA ZERO to provide powerful analytics capabilities while leveraging WordPress for ease of installation and management.

searchDocs.title: License Activation
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Obtaining a License Key‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Before you can activate QA ZERO premium, you need to purchase a license:  Visit the QA ZERO websiteSelect your preferred license tierComplete the checkout processYou will receive your license key via emailThe license key will also be available in your account dashboard

searchDocs.title: Standard Activation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to QA ZERO > LicenseEnter your license key in the provided fieldEnter your email address in the provided fieldClick Activate the licenseIf successful, you'll see a confirmation message and a celebration animation

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting Activation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you encounter issues during activation:  Verify that you've entered the license key correctly (no extra spaces)Check your internet connectionEnsure your server can make outbound connectionsTemporarily disable security plugins or firewalls that might block the activation request  For more detailed troubleshooting, see the License Errors section.

searchDocs.title: Verifying Activation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After activation, you can verify that your license is working correctly:  Navigate to QA ZERO > DashboardCheck that premium features are now availableTry accessing a premium feature like session recording

searchDocs.title: License Information‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Once activated, you can view your license information:  Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseView your license details: Last authentication timeActivation status

searchDocs.title: Deactivating Your License‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you need to move your license to another site:  Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseClick Deactivate this licenseConfirm the deactivationYour license can now be activated on another site

searchDocs.title: "Invalid License Key" Error‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This error occurs when:  The license key is entered incorrectlyThe license has expiredThe license has been revoked  Solution: Verify your license key and status in your QA ZERO account.

searchDocs.title: "License Activation Limit Reached" Error‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This error occurs when:  You've activated the license on the maximum number of sites allowed by your license tierYou're trying to activate a license on too many sites  Solution: Deactivate the license on an unused site.

searchDocs.title: "Connection Error" During Activation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: This error occurs when:  Your server cannot connect to the QA ZERO license serverA firewall is blocking the connectionYour hosting has restrictions on outbound connections  Solution: Contact your hosting provider to ensure outbound connections are allowed.

searchDocs.title: Getting Help‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you continue to experience activation issues:  Check the QA ZERO Knowledge Base for license-related articlesContact QA ZERO support with: Your license key (last 4 characters only for security)WordPress versionQA ZERO plugin versionError messages you're receivingSteps you've already taken to troubleshoot

searchDocs.title: Article Data Analysis
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Accessing Article Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: There are two ways to access article-specific data in QA ZERO:

searchDocs.title: Method 1: From the Dashboard‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > DashboardScroll down to the Popular Pages sectionClick on any article title to view its detailed analytics

searchDocs.title: Method 2: From the Content Analytics Section‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics > ContentBrowse or search for the article you want to analyzeClick on the article title to view detailed analytics

searchDocs.title: Article Overview Dashboard‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Article Overview Dashboard provides a comprehensive view of how users interact with a specific article.    Key metrics include:  Page Views: Total number of times the article has been viewedUnique Visitors: Number of individual users who viewed the articleAverage Time on Page: How long users typically spend reading the articleBounce Rate: Percentage of visitors who leave after viewing only this pageScroll Depth: How far down the page users typically scrollEngagement Rate: Combined metric of time on page and user interactions

searchDocs.title: Reading Patterns‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Reading Patterns section shows how users consume your content.    Key insights include:  Reading Flow: Visual representation of how users read your contentAttention Hotspots: Areas that receive the most attentionSkimming Behavior: Sections that users tend to skim rather than read thoroughlyDrop-off Points: Locations where users typically stop reading

searchDocs.title: Click Analysis‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Click Analysis section shows where users click within your article.    Key features include:  Click Heatmap: Visual representation of clicks throughout the articleLink Performance: Statistics for each link in the articleCTA Performance: How well call-to-action buttons performNon-link Clicks: Areas where users click that aren't links (potential confusion points)

searchDocs.title: Traffic Sources‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Traffic Sources section shows how users are finding your article.    Sources are categorized as:  Direct: Users who typed the URL or used a bookmarkSearch: Traffic from search enginesSocial: Visitors from social media platformsReferral: Traffic from other websitesInternal: Users who navigated from another page on your siteEmail: Visitors who clicked a link in an email

searchDocs.title: User Flow‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The User Flow section shows where users come from before viewing the article and where they go afterward.    This helps you understand:  Entry Pages: Which pages users visit before arriving at this articleExit Pages: Where users go after reading this articleNavigation Patterns: Common paths users take through your content

searchDocs.title: Conversion Impact‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The Conversion Impact section shows how this article contributes to your conversion goals.    Key metrics include:  Goal Completions: Number of conversions influenced by this articleConversion Rate: Percentage of article viewers who complete a goalValue Contribution: Estimated value generated by this article

searchDocs.title: Exporting Article Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To export data for reporting or further analysis:  Navigate to the article analytics pageClick the Export button in the top right cornerSelect your preferred format (PDF, CSV, Excel)Choose which data sections to includeClick Download

searchDocs.title: Using Article Data for Optimization‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use article data to:  Identify and fix sections with high drop-off ratesOptimize underperforming calls-to-actionImprove internal linking strategy based on user flowCreate more content similar to high-performing articlesAdjust content length based on scroll depth and engagement metrics

searchDocs.title: Accessing Heatmap Functionality‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Since QA ZERO is an independent analytics server that uses WordPress as middleware, heatmaps are accessed through the Analytics interface:  Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tab in the analytics interface

searchDocs.title: Types of Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The QA ZERO analytics server processes visitor data to generate several types of heatmaps:

searchDocs.title: Click Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Click heatmaps show where users click on your page. Areas with more clicks appear "hotter" (red/orange), while areas with fewer clicks appear "cooler" (blue/green).    Use click heatmaps to:  Identify which elements attract the most attentionDiscover if users are clicking on non-clickable elementsOptimize the placement of important links and buttons

searchDocs.title: Scroll Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Scroll heatmaps show how far users scroll down your page. The color gradient indicates the percentage of users who reached each part of the page.    Use scroll heatmaps to:  Determine if users see important content below the foldIdentify the optimal placement for key informationImprove page layout to encourage deeper scrolling

searchDocs.title: Move Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Move heatmaps track mouse movement patterns, showing where users hover their cursor.    Use move heatmaps to:  Understand what content attracts user attentionIdentify areas that users find interesting but may not click onOptimize the placement of important information

searchDocs.title: Configuring Heatmap Analysis‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To configure which pages to analyze with heatmaps:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabClick Configure TrackingSelect the pages you want to track: Specific URLURL pattern (using wildcards)Page type (homepage, posts, pages, etc.) Set the data collection periodClick Save Configuration  The analytics server will then begin collecting and processing data for the specified pages.

searchDocs.title: Viewing and Analyzing Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To view and analyze your heatmaps:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to analyze from the listUse the date range selector to filter data by time periodUse the device filter to view data for specific devices (desktop, tablet, mobile)Use the visitor segment filter to analyze behavior of specific user groups

searchDocs.title: Interpreting Heatmap Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: When analyzing heatmaps, look for:  Hot spots: Areas with high user engagement (red/orange)Cold spots: Areas with low user engagement (blue/green)Unexpected patterns: Clicks on non-clickable elements or unusual scroll patternsFold line: The point where users need to scroll to see more contentEngagement drop-offs: Points where user engagement significantly decreases

searchDocs.title: Comparing Heatmaps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The analytics server allows you to compare heatmaps to identify changes in user behavior:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to analyzeClick Compare PeriodsSelect two different time periods to compareUse the comparison view to see differences between the two periods

searchDocs.title: Exporting Heatmap Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To export heatmap data for reporting or further analysis:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Analytics in the main menuSelect the Heatmaps tabChoose the page you want to export data forClick ExportChoose your preferred format (PNG, PDF, CSV)Click Download

searchDocs.title: Best Practices‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Collect data for at least 1,000 page views to ensure statistical significanceCreate separate analyses for desktop and mobile usersCompare heatmaps before and after making changes to your websiteUse heatmaps in conjunction with other analytics data for a complete pictureRegularly review heatmaps to identify optimization opportunities

searchDocs.title: Compatible Caching Plugins‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO works well with most popular caching plugins, including:  WP RocketW3 Total CacheWP Super CacheLiteSpeed CacheAutoptimize

searchDocs.title: Potential Issues‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Caching plugins may cache the QA ZERO tracking code, which can lead to inaccurate data collection. To prevent this:  Exclude QA ZERO Scripts: Configure your caching plugin to exclude QA ZERO JavaScript files from being cached or minified.Dynamic Content: Ensure your caching plugin is configured to handle dynamic content correctly.

searchDocs.title: Configuration Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: WP Rocket‚Äã  Go to WP Rocket > Advanced RulesAdd the following to the "Never Cache URLs" section: /wp-content/plugins/qa-zero/ Add the following to the "Excluded JavaScript Files" section: /wp-content/plugins/qa-zero/js/ Save changes  W3 Total Cache‚Äã  Go to Performance > MinifyAdd the following to the "Never minify the following JS files" section: /wp-content/plugins/qa-zero/js/ Save changes

searchDocs.title: Compatible Security Plugins‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO is compatible with most security plugins, including:  WordfenceSucuriiThemes SecurityAll In One WP Security

searchDocs.title: Potential Issues‚Äã

To prevent this:  Whitelist QA ZERO: Add QA ZERO's scripts and API endpoints to your security plugin's whitelist.Adjust Firewall Rules: Modify firewall rules to allow QA ZERO's necessary operations.

searchDocs.title: Configuration Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Wordfence‚Äã  Go to Wordfence > FirewallClick on "Allowlisted URLs"Add the following patterns: /wp-content/plugins/qa-zero/ /wp-admin/admin-ajax.php Save changes

searchDocs.title: Theme Layout Issues
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Heatmap Overlay Misalignment‚Äã
searchDocs.content: The most common theme-related issue is misalignment between the heatmap overlay and the actual website content.    Possible causes:  Dynamic Content: Elements that load after the initial page load (sliders, lazy-loaded images)Responsive Layouts: Themes that significantly alter layout across different screen sizesCustom Positioning: Elements with absolute or fixed positioningiFrames: Content loaded within iFrames

searchDocs.title: Solution Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedEnable Delayed Tracking and set the delay to 2-3 secondsEnable Enhanced Element TrackingSave changes and test the heatmap again  For persistent issues:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > AdvancedIn the Custom Code section, add the following JavaScript: window.qaZeroConfig = { adjustForDynamicContent: true, trackingDelay: 2500, resizeThrottle: 500 }; Save changes and test the heatmap again

searchDocs.title: WordPress Default Themes‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO works well with all default WordPress themes (Twenty Twenty, Twenty Twenty-One, etc.) without any special configuration.

searchDocs.title: Fixing Z-index Issues‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Handling Custom Post Types‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If your theme uses custom post types with unique layouts:  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > TrackingUnder Content Types, ensure your custom post types are selectedClick Advanced SettingsConfigure tracking settings specifically for each custom post typeSave changes

searchDocs.title: Mobile Theme Compatibility‚Äã

searchDocs.title: AMP Pages Compatibility‚Äã
searchDocs.content: For themes that support AMP (Accelerated Mobile Pages):  Navigate to QA ZERO > Settings > IntegrationsEnable AMP Compatibility ModeChoose whether to track AMP pages separately or combine with regular page dataSave changes

searchDocs.title: Custom Theme Hooks‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Testing After Theme Updates‚Äã

searchDocs.title: Frequently Asked Questions (Start Guide)
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO just a WordPress plugin?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: No. QA ZERO is an independent analytics infrastructure that happens to use WordPress only as a middleware layer for setup and system management. It is not a WordPress CMS plugin in the traditional sense ‚Äî it does not interact with posts, pages, or themes as content. Instead, it uses WordPress purely as a lightweight UI and plugin framework.

searchDocs.title: Why does QA ZERO use WordPress?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: WordPress is used exclusively as a familiar and extensible runtime environment. QA ZERO leverages WordPress's plugin system and admin interface for easy deployment and operation, but all analytics processing, data handling, and visualization are entirely independent from WordPress‚Äôs content features. Think of QA ZERO as a stand-alone server app that simply uses WordPress to "host" its management UI.

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO compatible with my WordPress theme?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Theme compatibility is irrelevant. QA ZERO does not render or affect your WordPress site's front-end. Since it operates independently from WordPress's public pages and templates, your theme has no impact on its functionality. The plugin runs as a private analytics interface within the admin dashboard.

searchDocs.title: Will QA ZERO slow down my website?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: No. QA ZERO is optimized for performance. The tracking script loads asynchronously and does not block rendering. All analytics data is processed server-side in a way that is completely detached from your website's core operation.

searchDocs.title: Can I use QA ZERO with a caching plugin?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Yes. Since QA ZERO doesn't modify your visible site pages, it is compatible with most caching plugins. However, make sure the tracking script is excluded from page caching if needed. Details are available in the Plugin Compatibility section.

searchDocs.title: How long does it take to start seeing data?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Tracking begins as soon as the script is active on your site. Most users see data in the dashboard within a few minutes. For more comprehensive results like heatmaps, we recommend letting QA ZERO collect data for at least 24‚Äì48 hours.

searchDocs.title: Can I exclude certain users from being tracked?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Yes. You can exclude logged-in users, specific user roles, or IP addresses using the built-in settings in the QA ZERO admin panel.

searchDocs.title: Do I need to add any code to my website?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: No manual code insertion is required. QA ZERO automatically injects the tracking script into your site's pages once activated.

searchDocs.title: Is QA ZERO GDPR compliant?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Yes. QA ZERO is built with privacy in mind. It includes several tools to support GDPR and other privacy frameworks:  No reliance on cookiesIP address anonymizationConfigurable data retention periodsExport and deletion tools for user dataRespect for opt-out signals from consent tools

searchDocs.title: Does QA ZERO use cookies?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: No. QA ZERO is designed to be 100% cookieless. It uses privacy-friendly fingerprinting and session correlation techniques that do not store data on the user‚Äôs device.

searchDocs.title: Can visitors opt out of tracking?‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Yes. QA ZERO respects signals from consent tools (such as CookieYes) and disables tracking accordingly. If a visitor opts out, no data is recorded.

searchDocs.title: Installation
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Understanding the Installation Process‚Äã
searchDocs.content: While QA ZERO is distributed as a WordPress plugin for convenience, it's important to understand that you're actually installing an independent analytics server that uses WordPress as middleware. The WordPress plugin format simply provides an easy installation and management interface for the underlying analytics server.

searchDocs.title: System Requirements‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Before installing QA ZERO, ensure your system meets the following requirements:  WordPress 5.5 or higherPHP 7.4 or higherMySQL 5.6 or higherModern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)Sufficient server resources to run the analytics server (minimum 1GB RAM recommended)

searchDocs.title: Method 1: Install from WordPress Plugin Directory‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Log in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to Plugins > Add NewSearch for "QA ZERO"Click Install Now next to the QA ZERO pluginAfter installation completes, click Activate

searchDocs.title: Method 2: Manual Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Download the QA ZERO plugin ZIP file from our website or the WordPress plugin directoryLog in to your WordPress admin dashboardNavigate to Plugins > Add NewClick the Upload Plugin button at the top of the pageClick Choose File and select the QA ZERO ZIP file you downloadedClick Install NowAfter installation completes, click Activate

searchDocs.title: What Happens During Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: When you activate QA ZERO, the following components are set up:  WordPress Integration Layer: Creates the management interface within your WordPress adminAnalytics Server Core: Installs the independent analytics engine that processes visitor dataData Collection Scripts: Adds the necessary tracking code to your website

searchDocs.title: Verifying Installation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To verify that QA ZERO has been installed correctly:  In your WordPress admin dashboard, you should see a new menu item labeled "QA ZERO"Click on the QA ZERO menu to access the analytics dashboardYou should see the QA ZERO welcome screen with server status information    If you don't see the QA ZERO menu or encounter any errors, please refer to the Troubleshooting section.

searchDocs.title: Next Steps‚Äã
searchDocs.content: After successfully installing the QA ZERO analytics server, proceed to the Initial Setup guide to configure your analytics environment.

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting Data Loss
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Complete Data Loss‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Complete data loss occurs when all historical data disappears from your QA ZERO dashboard.  Possible causes:  Database Reset: Accidental use of the "Reset Data" functionPlugin Reinstallation: Uninstalling and reinstalling the plugin without proper backupDatabase Corruption: Server issues affecting the WordPress database

searchDocs.title: Partial Data Loss‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Partial data loss occurs when some data is missing for specific time periods or pages.  Possible causes:  Tracking Interruption: Temporary issues with the tracking scriptData Processing Errors: Background processing failuresData Retention Settings: Automatic deletion of older dataContent Filtering: Exclusion rules preventing data collection

searchDocs.title: Check Data Collection Status‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > DashboardCheck the dashboard for recent dataIf recent data is visible, data collection is currently working

searchDocs.title: Verify Recent Data‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > UserSet the date range to "Today" or "Yesterday"Check if recent data is being recordedIf recent data exists but historical data is missing, the issue is likely with stored data rather than collection

searchDocs.title: Check WordPress Database‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use a database management tool like phpMyAdminCheck the WordPress database tables related to QA ZEROVerify that the tables exist and contain data

searchDocs.title: Review WordPress Error Logs‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Check your WordPress error logsLook for errors related to QA ZERONote the timestamps of any relevant errors

searchDocs.title: Data Retention Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO automatically removes old data based on your retention settings:  Navigate to QA ZERO > SettingsSelect the Site Management tabCheck the Data Retention Period settingIf set to a short period (e.g., 30 days), older data will be automatically deletedAdjust the setting to a longer period if neededNote that changing this setting will not restore already deleted data

searchDocs.title: Database Issues‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Database corruption can cause data loss:  Use a database management tool like phpMyAdminCheck the WordPress database tables related to QA ZERORepair or optimize the database tables if needed  For severe database issues:  Check your server's error logs for database-related errorsContact your hosting provider for assistance with database repairRestore from a backup if available

searchDocs.title: Tracking Script Issues‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If the tracking script was temporarily disabled or broken:  Navigate to QA ZERO > TagVerify that the tracking code is properly installedIf using a caching plugin, clear your cacheCheck your site again to see if tracking is working

searchDocs.title: Plugin Conflicts‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Other plugins may interfere with QA ZERO's data collection or storage:  Temporarily deactivate other plugins one by oneAfter each deactivation, check if QA ZERO data collection worksIf you identify a conflicting plugin, check the Plugin Compatibility section for specific guidance

searchDocs.title: Server Resource Limitations‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Limited server resources can prevent data processing:  Check your server's PHP memory limit and execution timeEnsure your server meets the minimum requirements (PHP 5.6+, 64MB memory)If resources are limited, contact your hosting provider about upgrading

searchDocs.title: From Backup‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you have a backup of your WordPress database:  Restore the database from backupVerify that QA ZERO tables are included in the backupReactivate the plugin if necessary

searchDocs.title: Using WordPress Database Tools‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you need to recover data from a corrupted database:  Use a database management tool like phpMyAdminCheck the WordPress database tables related to QA ZERORepair or optimize the database tables if neededIf necessary, consult with a database administrator

searchDocs.title: From Browser Cache‚Äã
searchDocs.content: In some cases, limited data may still exist in visitors' browsers:  Note that QA ZERO uses localStorage for some temporary dataThis data is limited and may not represent a complete recovery solutionFor reliable data recovery, always maintain regular database backups

searchDocs.title: Regular Backups‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Set up regular database backups:  Use a WordPress backup plugin or your hosting provider's backup toolsEnsure that database backups include QA ZERO tablesConfigure backup frequency and retentionStore backups in a secure location (local or cloud)

searchDocs.title: Optimize Server Resources‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Reduce the risk of data processing failures:  Ensure your server meets the minimum requirements (PHP 5.6+, 64MB memory)Consider upgrading your hosting plan if you have a high-traffic siteRegularly check server logs for errors or warningsKeep WordPress and all plugins updated

searchDocs.title: Monitor Site Performance‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Monitor your site's performance:  Regularly check the QA ZERO dashboard for any anomaliesUse WordPress health check tools to monitor overall site healthSet up uptime monitoring for your websiteRegularly check for plugin conflicts

searchDocs.title: Getting Support‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps above and still have issues:  Gather information about your system: WordPress versionPHP versionServer environmentQA ZERO plugin version Contact QA ZERO support with: Your system informationDescription of the data lossTime period affectedSteps you've already taken to troubleshoot

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting License Errors
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: Invalid License Key‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you see an "Invalid License Key" error:    Possible causes:  Typo in License Key: The license key was entered incorrectlyExpired License: The license has expired and needs renewalRevoked License: The license has been revoked due to terms violation

searchDocs.title: License Activation Limit Reached‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you see a "License Activation Limit Reached" error:    This means you've activated the license on the maximum number of sites allowed by your license tier.

searchDocs.title: Connection Error‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you see a "Connection Error" when trying to activate or verify your license:    This indicates that your WordPress site cannot connect to the QA ZERO license server.

searchDocs.title: License Deactivated Unexpectedly‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If your previously activated license shows as deactivated:    This can occur if the license was deactivated from another location or if there are connectivity issues.

searchDocs.title: Verify License Key‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseCheck the license key for typos or extra spacesRe-enter the license key if necessaryClick Activate License

searchDocs.title: Check License Status‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://mem.quarka.org/tsushin/Check the status, expiration date, and activation count of your licenseIf expired, renew your license

searchDocs.title: Deactivate Unused Sites‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you've reached your activation limit:  Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseClick Deactivate License to free up an activation slotYou can then activate the license on another site

searchDocs.title: Fix Connection Issues‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you're experiencing connection issues:  Check if your server can connect to the license server at mem.quarka.orgVerify that your server has outbound connection capabilitiesTemporarily disable any security plugins or firewallsContact your hosting provider to ensure they don't block outbound connections

searchDocs.title: Retry License Activation‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If automatic activation fails, you can try these steps:  Navigate to QA ZERO > LicenseCheck your internet connectionVerify that your server can connect to mem.quarka.orgClear your browser cacheTry activating the license again

searchDocs.title: Understanding License Tiers‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO offers several license tiers:  Tier	Features	LimitationsFree	Basic analytics, click heatmap	1 page only Friend	Basic analytics, click heatmap	Limited pages Personal	Full analytics, all heatmap types	Standard support Light	Full analytics, all heatmap types	Enhanced support Business	All features + advanced reporting	Priority support Business Plus	All features + AI insights	Premium support Agent	All features + white labeling	Dedicated support Enterprise	Custom solutions	Custom support

searchDocs.title: Upgrading Your License‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To upgrade your license:  Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://mem.quarka.org/tsushin/Purchase the new license tierActivate the new license key on your siteYour license will be automatically upgraded

searchDocs.title: Downgrading Your License‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To downgrade your license:  Wait until your current license expiresPurchase the lower-tier licenseActivate the new license on your site  Note that downgrading may result in loss of access to certain features.

searchDocs.title: Automatic Renewal‚Äã
searchDocs.content: By default, QA ZERO licenses are set to renew automatically:  You will receive email notifications before the renewal dateThe renewal will use the payment method on fileYour license will continue without interruption

searchDocs.title: Manual Renewal‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you've disabled automatic renewal:  Log in to your QA ZERO account at https://mem.quarka.org/tsushin/Purchase a renewal for your licenseYour license will be renewed

searchDocs.title: Renewal Benefits‚Äã
searchDocs.content: QA ZERO offers benefits for renewing your license:  Continued access to premium featuresAccess to updates and new featuresOngoing support for your installation

searchDocs.title: Transferring Licenses‚Äã
searchDocs.content: To transfer a license to a different site:  Deactivate the license on the current siteNavigate to QA ZERO > License on the new siteEnter your license keyClick Activate License

searchDocs.title: Getting Support for License Issues‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you continue to experience license issues:  Contact QA ZERO support with: Your license key (last 4 characters only for security)Description of the issueScreenshots of any error messagesSteps you've already taken to troubleshootYour WordPress and PHP versions

searchDocs.title: Troubleshooting Recording Issues
searchDocs.keywords: QA ZERO  WordPress  analytics  heatmap  documentation

searchDocs.title: No Data Being Recorded‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you're not seeing any data in your QA ZERO dashboard:  Verify Tracking is Enabled‚Äã  Navigate to QA ZERO > SettingsSelect the Site Management tabEnsure tracking options are enabledSave changes if needed  Check Script Installation‚Äã  Visit your website in an incognito/private browsing windowRight-click and select "View Page Source"Search for "qa-zero" in the source codeVerify the tracking script is present in the <head> or before the closing </body> tag    If the script is missing:  Navigate to QA ZERO > TagVerify that the tracking code is properly installedIf using a caching plugin, clear your cacheCheck your site again  Check for JavaScript Errors‚Äã  Open your website in Chrome or FirefoxOpen the browser's developer tools (F12 or right-click > Inspect)Go to the Console tabLook for any errors related to QA ZERO

searchDocs.title: Partial Data Recording‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If some data is being recorded but not all:  Check Tracking Configuration‚Äã  Navigate to QA ZERO > SettingsSelect the Site Management tabVerify that all desired tracking options are enabledSave changes if needed  Check Site Configuration‚Äã  Navigate to QA ZERO > SettingsReview the settings in all tabs to ensure proper configurationMake sure your site type and attributes are correctly setSave changes if needed

searchDocs.title: Heatmap Not Displaying Correctly‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If heatmaps are not displaying correctly on your pages:  Check Page Compatibility‚Äã  Navigate to QA ZERO > BehaviorSelect the page with the problematic heatmapCheck if the page content has changed significantly since data collectionIf needed, clear old data and collect new heatmap data  Adjust Browser View‚Äã  Navigate to QA ZERO > BehaviorSelect the page with the problematic heatmapTry switching between device views (desktop, tablet, mobile)Check if the heatmap displays correctly in different views

searchDocs.title: Chrome‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If recording issues occur specifically in Chrome:  Check if any ad blockers or privacy extensions are installedVerify that third-party cookies are allowedTry disabling any content blocking features

searchDocs.title: Safari‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Safari's Intelligent Tracking Prevention (ITP) can affect analytics:  QA ZERO is designed to work with Safari's privacy featuresNo special configuration is typically neededIf issues persist, check for browser-specific console errors

searchDocs.title: Firefox‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If recording issues occur specifically in Firefox:  Check if Enhanced Tracking Protection is blocking QA ZEROQA ZERO is designed to work with Firefox's privacy featuresIf issues persist, check for browser-specific console errors

searchDocs.title: Plugin Conflict Resolution‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you suspect a plugin conflict:  Temporarily deactivate other plugins one by oneAfter each deactivation, check if QA ZERO recording worksIf you identify a conflicting plugin, check the Plugin Compatibility section for specific guidance

searchDocs.title: PHP Settings‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Ensure your server meets these requirements:  PHP 5.6 or higherMemory limit: 64MB or higherMax execution time: 30 seconds or higherPOST max size: 8MB or higher

searchDocs.title: WordPress Configuration‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Check these WordPress settings:  Ensure WordPress address (URL) and Site address (URL) are correctly set in Settings > GeneralVerify that permalink settings are configured and working

searchDocs.title: Manual Script Verification‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Add this code to your theme's header.php file (before the closing </head> tag) to force the tracking script:  <?php if (function_exists('qahm_zero_print_tracking_code')) { qahm_zero_print_tracking_code(); } ?>

searchDocs.title: Database Verification‚Äã
searchDocs.content: Use a database management tool like phpMyAdminCheck the WordPress database tables related to QA ZEROVerify that the tables exist and contain dataIf issues are found, consider reinstalling the plugin

searchDocs.title: Getting Support‚Äã
searchDocs.content: If you've tried the troubleshooting steps above and still have issues:  Gather information about your system: WordPress versionPHP versionServer environmentBrowser and device information Contact QA ZERO support with: Your system informationDescription of the issueSteps you've already taken to troubleshootScreenshots of any error messages
